facts.fact_text: The HCOB Italy Construction PMI edged down to 47.7 in January 2026 from 47.9 in December, signaling a third straight month of contraction.

evidences.evidence_text: The HCOB Italy Construction PMI edged down to 47.7 in January 2026 from 47.9 in December, signaling a third straight month of contraction

facts.fact_text: Order books fell at one of the steepest rates in over a year.

evidences.evidence_text: Order books fell at one of the steepest rates in over a year

facts.fact_text: Employment growth accelerated to a seven-month high.

evidences.evidence_text: employment growth accelerated to a seven-month high

facts.fact_text: Input cost inflation picked up due to higher raw material and energy prices.

evidences.evidence_text: Input cost inflation picked up due to higher raw material and energy prices

claims.claim_text: Uncertainty dampened demand, prompting firms to scale back input buying.

evidences.evidence_text: Order books fell at one of the steepest rates in over a year as uncertainty dampened demand, prompting firms to scale back input buying.

claims.claim_text: Business confidence weakened but remained marginally positive.

evidences.evidence_text: Business confidence weakened but remained marginally positive, with firms citing expected future projects even as uncertainty around the PNRR deadline tempered sentiment.

evidence.evidence_text: Italian Construction PMI Contracts Further in January
Input cost inflation picked up due to higher raw material and energy prices, though overall pressures stayed below long-run averages.
Despite softer workloads, employment growth accelerated to a seven-month high as companies favored permanent staff.
Order books fell at one of the steepest rates in over a year as uncertainty dampened demand
